Proverbs__04.1: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend that you may know prudence.
Proverbs__04.2: I will give you a good gift, forsake not my law.
Proverbs__04.3: For I also was my father's son, tender and as an only son in the sight of my mother:
Proverbs__04.4: And he taught me, and said: Let thy heart receive my words, keep my commandments, and thou shalt live.
Proverbs__04.5: Get wisdom, get prudence: forget not, neither decline from the words of my mouth.
Proverbs__04.6: Forsake her not, and she shall keep thee: love her, and she shall preserve thee.
Proverbs__04.7: The beginning of wisdom, get wisdom, and with all thy possession purchase prudence.
Proverbs__04.8: Take hold on her, and she shall exalt thee: thou shalt be glorified by her, when thou shalt embrace her.
Proverbs__04.9: She shall give to thy head increase of graces, and protect thee with a noble crown.
Proverbs__04.10: Hear, O my son, and receive my words, that years of life may be multiplied to thee.
Proverbs__04.11: I will shew thee the way of wisdom, I will lead thee by the paths of equity:
Proverbs__04.12: Which when thou shalt have entered, thy steps shall not be straitened, and when thou runnest thou shalt not meet a stumblingblock.
Proverbs__04.13: Take hold on instruction, leave it not: keep it, because it is thy life.
Proverbs__04.14: Be not delighted in the paths of the wicked, neither let the way of evil men please thee.
Proverbs__04.15: Flee from it, pass not by it: go aside, and forsake it.
Proverbs__04.16: For they sleep not except they have done evil: and their sleep is taken away unless they have made some to fall.
Proverbs__04.17: They eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of iniquity.
Proverbs__04.18: But the path of the just, as a shining light, goeth forwards and increaseth even to perfect day.
Proverbs__04.19: The way of the wicked is darksome: they know not where they fall.
Proverbs__04.20: My son, hearken to my words, and incline thy ear to my sayings.
Proverbs__04.21: Let them not depart from thy eyes, keep them in the midst of thy heart:
Proverbs__04.22: For they are life to those that find them, and health to all flesh.
Proverbs__04.23: With all watchfulness keep thy heart, because life issueth out from it.
Proverbs__04.24: Remove from thee a froward mouth, and let detracting lips be far from thee.
Proverbs__04.25: Let thy eyes look straight on, and let thy eyelids go before thy steps.
Proverbs__04.26: Make straight the path for thy feet, and all thy ways shall be established.
Proverbs__04.27: Decline not to the right hand, nor to the left: turn away thy foot from evil. For the Lord knoweth the ways that are on the right hand: but those are perverse which are on the left hand. But he will make thy courses straight, he will bring forward thy ways in peace.
